note.p: Education: University College, London. MB (1858), MD (1859); MA (Hon Cantab); BA (Lond)

Career: Fellow of Trinity College, Cambridge, and of University College, London; Prelector of Physiology, Trinity College, Cambridge; Fullerian Professor of Physiology, Royal Institution London; Professor of Practical Physiology, University College, London.
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1908 vol 80 pp lxxi-lxxxi, plate, signed by W H G
References: Sir Henry Dale, 'Sir Michael Foster, KCB, FRS, a Secretary of the Royal Society' in NR 1964 vol 19 pp 10-32, plate
Stewart Richards, 'Conan Doyle's "Challenger" Unchampioned: William Rutherford, FRS (1839-99), and the Origins of Practical Physiology in Britain' in NR 1985-86 vol 40 pp 193-217
E M Tansey, 'George Eliot's Support for Physiology: the George Henry Lewes Trust 1879-1939' in NR 1990 vol 44 pp 221-240
A H Sykes, 'Foster and Sharpey's tour of Europe' in NR 2000 vol 54 pp 47-52
